00037 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_RPC
00038 #include <obd_support.h>
00039 #include <obd_class.h>
00040 #include <lustre_net.h>
00041 
00042 #include "ptlrpc_internal.h"
00043 
00044 static struct cfs_hash *conn_hash;
00045 static struct cfs_hash_ops conn_hash_ops;
00046 
00047 struct ptlrpc_connection *
00048 ptlrpc_connection_get(lnet_process_id_t peer, lnet_nid_t self,
00049                       struct obd_uuid *uuid)
00050 {
00051         struct ptlrpc_connection *conn, *conn2;
00052         ENTRY;
00053 
00054         conn = cfs_hash_lookup(conn_hash, &peer);
00055         if (conn)
00056                 GOTO(out, conn);
00057 
00058         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(conn);
00059         if (!conn)
00060                 RETURN(NULL);
00061 
00062         conn->c_peer = peer;
00063         conn->c_self = self;
00064         INIT_HLIST_NODE(&conn->c_hash);
00065         atomic_set(&conn->c_refcount, 1);
00066         if (uuid)
00067                 obd_str2uuid(&conn->c_remote_uuid, uuid->uuid);
00068 
00069         /*
00070          * Add the newly created conn to the hash, on key collision we
00071          * lost a racing addition and must destroy our newly allocated
00072          * connection.  The object which exists in the has will be
00073          * returned and may be compared against out object.
00074          */
00075         /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
00076          * conn_keycmp() */
00077         /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
00078         conn2 = cfs_hash_findadd_unique(conn_hash, &peer, &conn->c_hash);
00079         if (conn != conn2) {
00080                 OBD_FREE_PTR(conn);
00081                 conn = conn2;
00082         }
00083         EXIT;
00084 out:
00085         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "conn=%p refcount %d to %s\n",
00086                conn, atomic_read(&conn->c_refcount),
00087                libcfs_nid2str(conn->c_peer.nid));
00088         return conn;
00089 }
00090 
00091 int ptlrpc_connection_put(struct ptlrpc_connection *conn)
00092 {
00093         int rc = 0;
00094         ENTRY;
00095 
00096         if (!conn)
00097                 RETURN(rc);
00098 
00099         LASSERT(atomic_read(&conn->c_refcount) > 1);
00100 
00101         /*
00102          * We do not remove connection from hashtable and
00103          * do not free it even if last caller released ref,
00104          * as we want to have it cached for the case it is
00105          * needed again.
00106          *
00107          * Deallocating it and later creating new connection
00108          * again would be wastful. This way we also avoid
00109          * expensive locking to protect things from get/put
00110          * race when found cached connection is freed by
00111          * ptlrpc_connection_put().
00112          *
00113          * It will be freed later in module unload time,
00114          * when ptlrpc_connection_fini()->lh_exit->conn_exit()
00115          * path is called.
00116          */
00117         if (atomic_dec_return(&conn->c_refcount) == 1)
00118                 rc = 1;
00119 
00120         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "PUT conn=%p refcount %d to %s\n",
00121                conn, atomic_read(&conn->c_refcount),
00122                libcfs_nid2str(conn->c_peer.nid));
00123 
00124         RETURN(rc);
00125 }
00126 
00127 struct ptlrpc_connection *
00128 ptlrpc_connection_addref(struct ptlrpc_connection *conn)
00129 {
00130         ENTRY;
00131 
00132         atomic_inc(&conn->c_refcount);
00133         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "conn=%p refcount %d to %s\n",
00134                conn, atomic_read(&conn->c_refcount),
00135                libcfs_nid2str(conn->c_peer.nid));
00136 
00137         RETURN(conn);
00138 }
00139 
00140 int ptlrpc_connection_init(void)
00141 {
00142         ENTRY;
00143 
00144         conn_hash = cfs_hash_create("CONN_HASH",
00145                                     HASH_CONN_CUR_BITS,
00146                                     HASH_CONN_MAX_BITS,
00147                                     HASH_CONN_BKT_BITS, 0,
00148                                     CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA,
00149                                     CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA,
00150                                     &conn_hash_ops, CFS_HASH_DEFAULT);
00151         if (!conn_hash)
00152                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00153 
00154         RETURN(0);
00155 }
00156 
00157 void ptlrpc_connection_fini(void) {
00158         ENTRY;
00159         cfs_hash_putref(conn_hash);
00160         EXIT;
00161 }
00162 
00163 /*
00164  * Hash operations for net_peer<->connection
00165  */
00166 static unsigned
00167 conn_hashfn(struct cfs_hash *hs, const void *key, unsigned mask)
00168 {
00169         return cfs_hash_djb2_hash(key, sizeof(lnet_process_id_t), mask);
00170 }
00171 
00172 static int
00173 conn_keycmp(const void *key, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00174 {
00175         struct ptlrpc_connection *conn;
00176         const lnet_process_id_t *conn_key;
00177 
00178         LASSERT(key != NULL);
00179         conn_key = (lnet_process_id_t *)key;
00180         conn = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ptlrpc_connection, c_hash);
00181 
00182         return conn_key->nid == conn->c_peer.nid &&
00183                conn_key->pid == conn->c_peer.pid;
00184 }
00185 
00186 static void *
00187 conn_key(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00188 {
00189         struct ptlrpc_connection *conn;
00190         conn = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ptlrpc_connection, c_hash);
00191         return &conn->c_peer;
00192 }
00193 
00194 static void *
00195 conn_object(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00196 {
00197         return hlist_entry(hnode, struct ptlrpc_connection, c_hash);
00198 }
00199 
00200 static void
00201 conn_get(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00202 {
00203         struct ptlrpc_connection *conn;
00204 
00205         conn = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ptlrpc_connection, c_hash);
00206         atomic_inc(&conn->c_refcount);
00207 }
00208 
00209 static void
00210 conn_put_locked(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00211 {
00212         struct ptlrpc_connection *conn;
00213 
00214         conn = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ptlrpc_connection, c_hash);
00215         atomic_dec(&conn->c_refcount);
00216 }
00217 
00218 static void
00219 conn_exit(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00220 {
00221         struct ptlrpc_connection *conn;
00222 
00223         conn = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ptlrpc_connection, c_hash);
00224         /*
00225          * Nothing should be left. Connection user put it and
00226          * connection also was deleted from table by this time
00227          * so we should have 0 refs.
00228          */
00229         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&conn->c_refcount) == 0,
00230                  "Busy connection with %d refs\n",
00231                  atomic_read(&conn->c_refcount));
00232         OBD_FREE_PTR(conn);
00233 }
00234 
00235 static struct cfs_hash_ops conn_hash_ops = {
00236         .hs_hash        = conn_hashfn,
00237         .hs_keycmp      = conn_keycmp,
00238         .hs_key         = conn_key,
00239         .hs_object      = conn_object,
00240         .hs_get         = conn_get,
00241         .hs_put_locked  = conn_put_locked,
00242         .hs_exit        = conn_exit,
00243 };
